A B C D E G H I L M N P R S T V

A

activateHUD(HUD) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Activates the HUD; since a HUD cannot be invisible and active, it is implicitly made visible at the same time; active HUDs receive input events, e.g mouse movement and keyboard presses.
activeColumnWidth - Variable in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDList
 
activeHUDGroupsStack - Variable in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
 
addHUD(HUD) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Adds the HUD to the set of current HUDs, and sets the HUD's reference to it's parent manager to point to this instance
addHUDs(HUDManager) - Static method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.Demo
In this example program, simply adds some hard-coded HUDs; a typical editor would load classes from some form of config file or etc to dynamically include additional features.
addShape(Shape) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.Document
Converts all added shapes to Area instances if they are not already, since Sun's 2D API was badly designed and prevents you from applying AffineTransforms to most shapes.
allHUDs - Variable in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
 

B

C

ContextManager - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ContextManager.
All input for the viewport is directed to this class, enabling it to keep track of cursor position, current button and keystates, etc.

D

Demo - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.Demo.
The automatically-run demo application that loads a few HUDs and lets you draw shapes etc

Document() - Constructor for class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.Document
 
deActivateHUD(HUD) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
De-activates the HUD, so that it gets NO input events, and cannot respond as a tool/control Inactive HUDs can still paint, if they are also visible.
display - Variable in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
 

E

exitExclusiveActiveHUD() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Restores all the previously active HUDs to their active state

G

getActiveHUDs() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Only returns HUDs that are both active and visible (assumes that invisible HUDs, which cannot give feedback on what the user is doing, should not be counted active - but leaves them "isActive() == true" so that as soon as they are made visible again they will automatically become active)
getAllHUDs() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Fetches all HUDs, regardless of status
getAllShapes() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.Document
 
getContext() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
The context that HUDs can query to find out e.g the most recent cursor co-ordinates
getCursorPosition() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ContextManager
 
getDocument() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ContextManager
The Document is a simple MVC Model containing data on what shapes there are, where they are, etc; it has all the data that would be "saved" if there were a load/save feature in this demo!
getMaximumSize() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDList
 
getMinimumSize() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDList
Sun's Swing API does automatic dynamic sized layout - it needs this method to tell it how much space to allocate to this particular GUI element (the HUDList)
getName() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.BaseHUD
 
getName() - Method in interface net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUD
Each HUD should have a unique user-readable name; must be unique, since it is used as a key in Maps
getPreferredSize() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDList
 
getShapesAtPoint(int[]) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.Document
 
getVisibleHUDs() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Fetches only HUDs that are visible, i.e are being painted to the main renderer

H

HUD - interface net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUD.
The base type for all HUD implementations; contains the major callbacks needed by the heads-up-editing system.
HUDList - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDList.
Useful control that allows the user to hide/show any layer and also to activate / de-activate any layer; also displays name and status of all layers, and shows their paint order
HUDList(HUDManager) - Constructor for class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDList
Requires a HUD manager so that it can retrieve the list of HUDs!
HUDManager - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager.
The main Model and Controller (in MVC terms) for managing the HUDs system.
HUDManager() - Constructor for class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
You MUST call setDisplayComponent before using this new instance
HUDManager - Variable in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.MainRenderer
 
hideHUD(HUD) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Renders the supplied HUD invisible, i.e it doesn't participate in repaints
hudManager - Variable in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDList

M

MainRenderer - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.MainRenderer.
A very simple main renderer that simply grabs a paint surface on every repaint (managed by Sun's windowing system, "Swing") and gets each visible HUD to paint to that surface in turn.
MainRenderer() - Constructor for class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.MainRenderer
Creates a renderer; you MUST call setManager() afterwards before using the renderer, otherwise it won't be able to get hold of any HUDs to render!
main(String[]) - Static method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.Demo

R

repaint() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Callback for HUDs to instruct the manager that they have changed their paint state and need a repaint of the main renderer

S

ShapeCreator - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ShapeCreator.
A simple HUD that, when active, draws a crosshair and responds to drag / click+move events by drawing a new Rectangle, and when the mouse is released it creates a new rectangle of that size + position and adds it to the base document
ShapeCreator() - Constructor for class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ShapeCreator
 
ShapeRenderer - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ShapeRenderer.
Very simple renderer that simply renders every shape in the base document using a unique colour for each.
ShapeRenderer() - Constructor for class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ShapeRenderer
 
ShapeShifter - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ShapeShifter.
 
ShapeShifter() - Constructor for class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ShapeShifter
 
ShapeShifter2 - class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ShapeShifter2.
Simple HUD which displays a "your mouse cursor is currently floating over THIS shape" selection-box style thing, and includes a tool which will allow you to drag shapes around the document, even multiple shapes at once (if they overlap and can be dragged in a single gesture).
ShapeShifter2() - Constructor for class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ShapeShifter2
 
setContext(ContextManager) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
 
setControlComponent(JComponent) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ContextManager
Informs this class which component it has to listen to to get input events etc so that it can correctly maintain it's context
setDisplayComponent(JComponent) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Informs this class which display component is the main renderer
setDocument(Document) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ContextManager
The Document is a simple MVC Model containing data on what shapes there are, where they are, etc; it has all the data that would be "saved" if there were a load/save feature in this demo!
setExclusiveActiveHUD(HUD) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Enables a HUD to temporarily mask out all currently active HUD's in favour of one in particular; once that HUD has completed it's action, it should call exitExclusiveHUD to re-enable all previously active HUDs.
setManager(HUDManager) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.BaseHUD
 
setManager(HUDManager) - Method in interface net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUD
Callback when added to a HUD manager to give the HUD a reference it can use to control or delegate to other HUDs etc
setManager(HUDManager) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.MainRenderer
 
setModel(ListModel) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDList
Internal use; uses the ListModel for easy compatibilty with Swing
setRelativeCursorPosition(int, int) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ContextManager
Sets cursor position ignoring any special transformations performed on the rendering surface (this method then automatically applies those transformations to the incoming co-ords before storing them)
shapes - Variable in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.Document
 
showHUD(HUD) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg.hue.HUDManager
Renders the supplied HUD visible, i.e it's paint callback is invoked on all repaints
